Course Description: THIS COURSE IS THE SECOND OF A TWO PART SERIES AS IT CONTINUES TO EXPOSE TO THE STUDENT TO FURTHER ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES, PRACTICES AND PROCEDURES. IT ALSO ENCOMPASSES REPORTING OF FINANCIAL POSITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS AND TRANSACTIONS FOR CORPORATIONS, AND PROPRIETORSHIPS
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
UPON THE SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF THIS COURSE, THE STUDENT WILL BE ABLE TO:
1. UNDERSTAND LONG TERM VS SHORT TERM LIABILITIES
2. BE ABLE TO PREPARE, READ AND UNDERSTAND A STATEMENT OF CASH FLOWS
3. BE ABLE TO PREPARE, READ AND UNDERSTAND A FINANCIAL STATEMENT
4. UNDERSTAND THE COST PROCESS
5. UNDERSTAND THE PERFORMANCE EVALUATION
Textbook(s):
ACCOUNTING, 26 ED. CHAPTERS 14-26
AUTHORS:  CARL S. WARREN; JAMES M. REEVE; JONATHAN DUCHAC 
CENGAGE LEARNING: ISBN-13:  9781305-08842-9
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
